37357176.review:
"I beat Contra without the Konami code." Yes I do and I must say this game has very much all the same mechanics of Contra and Super C: every new weapon replaces your current weapon, one hit and you're dead, 4 lives for starting... etc... An amazing game in my opinion! 

So the question is: how much this game differs from Contra?

1. The colors are very contrasted and closer to the Contras on NES but richer, more like a 16 bit game.
2. You can configure a button to "hold" (prevent moving while you shoot) and you can even customize if you want a toggle button or a button that you need to keep pressing to hold. This is even better than Contra: Hard Corps where you can only have the toggle button.
3. You can hold the button to shoot continuously. The laser doesn't shorten its range when you keep pressing. It's more like Contra: Hard Corps.
4. The enemy patterns are exactly the same than Contra and Super C. The big difference is that there is no limit in the number of sprites and projectiles on the screen.
5. The static enemies don't appear later like on NES, they appear as soon as they can be displayed on the screen and start shooting immediately.
6. The water behaves exactly like in Super C: you can crouch and you're invincible.
7. When you die you lose all your upgrades like in Contra and Super C.
8. When you stay alive longer you're granted extra lives.
9. New weapon: the E (more powerful than the laser, do an explosion that damage the surrounding, probably the best weapon in the game that I saw so far). I didn't see any F yet (great, it was useless). I saw only: the M, the L, the S and the E.
10. Unlimited continues like in Contra: Hard Corps (Japanese version)
11. Save slots! Every time you beat a level, you can restart from that level using your save slot. I don't know if that's a good feature for a Contra game to be honest... Maybe.
12. Every enemy spawn at the same time at the same place for every game. Like any Contra: nothing random.
13. There is an alternate fire that you can concentrate before shooting. Never used for now.
14. There are 2 possible character to choose but I think they have the same weapon. It's only a different visual appearance.

And the big question: is it harder or easier?

Equivalent: to give you an idea of how much time it will take you to beat a single level: I played for 47 minutes and I beat only the first 2 levels.

Harder: it plays like Contra, it looks like Contra but it's not Contra. For example, in level 2 there is a place where you can climb by the left side of the screen or the right side. The right side is close to impossible, the enemies respawn from there at quite a quick rate. In Contra I think all the paths you can take had the same difficulty.

Simpler: infinite continues, save slots.

Harder: more sprites, more enemies on the screen, more bullets... if you go too fast, you quickly end up in an impossible situation. If you wait you will accumulate enemies to a point you can't escape.

Overall for now it's somehow simpler than Contra: Hard Corps and a bit harder than Contra. A cool game and a must have for every fan of the serie.

33544371.review:
Super Cyborg is a very deliberate Contra clone executed with extreme attentiveness and precision.

Your cyborg controls exactly as Bill and Lance do in the NES games (or as the robots do in Probotector, the version clearly closest to the team's hearts) - at the same speed and with the same jumping arc, ensuring old hands won't have to alter their approach. The weapons have the same feel and impact, often the same sound effects. The explosions and the way enemies bounce away when hit are the same. Even the sense of progression through a place is the same, with each level culminating at the entrance to the next. Everything feels like home.

It doesn't just perfect the fundamentals, though. You also have at your disposal two key features from some of the later Contras. The first is the ability to lock yourself in position and fire in eight directions without moving (you don't have the option of locking the direction of fire [i]whilst[/i] moving, as in Shattered Soldier, but you won't miss it here). The second is the ability to charge your shots with an additional fire button. Like in Shattered Soldier, each weapon's charged shot has a unique function - charging the spread shot, for example, gives a devastating focused attack that vastly improves its effectiveness against bosses.

The weapon selection itself is familiar and conservative, and you still acquire weapons by shooting down pods that pass overhead at intervals. Crucially, though, the weapons are now all automatic. A few seconds into the first stage you'll have upgraded from your starting peashooter to the classic red-gobstopper machine gun (now with subtle muzzle flare), and not long after you'll have discovered the laser (which now gives a more continuous, reliable beam) and of course the spread shot, which you'll still want to hang onto for as long as possible. There's also an 'E' weapon that's literally just the fireball from Super C rendered as a purple blast of electricity, and the 'R' power-up which increases your rate of fire and reduces charge times. There's the screen-clearing smart-bomb, dropped rarely, and a 'B' power-up that grants you a generous few seconds of invincibility - anything that touches you during this time is toast. It's like the rare potion in the original Castlevania, except useful - it appears in places you'd want it to, places with a lot going on.

[i]Most of the game[/i] has a lot going on, of course. Super Cyborg is hard. Not just "Contra hard" or "NES hard", whatever those might mean. It's possibly harder than any Contra game to date, arcade or console, but without becoming the poorly-judged mess that fan-made tributes to difficult games often are. It manages to remain considered, doable and fair throughout. Most situations, setpieces, phases of bosses, etc, are fairly reasonable taken by themselves - it's their collective, unrelenting onslaught that's taxing. 

Though on the face of it the game's styled after the NES Contras, it shares a lot of its design sensibilities with Hard Corps and Shattered Soldier. It certainly has a much heavier focus on bosses and minibosses that require rote memorisation, for example - you're frequently tasked with learning how best to position yourself for each of a new boss's phases, and where the safe spots might be, etc. Timings can be strict and movements swift, but they're generally well telegraphed. 

You settle into each stage, after the initial shock, and start to appreciate its design. For the most part you're running and gunning as you always have - negotiating platforms whilst dodging fire from turrets or wall-crawling enemies and laying down a suppressing spread-shot fire on the respawning kamikaze cannon fodder. This is when Super Cyborg is at its most exhilarating. Then, and when you're finally clearing a stage after taking some time to practice. Any Contra fan will be familiar with the incredible sense of reward you get from having executed by the skin of your teeth a meticulously planned run, or having taken down a boss you had decided was beyond you. This game creates moments like these constantly. They are its most addictive draw and are felt all the more powerfully because they're so hard-won.

Where this clone perhaps makes a misstep is in its sudden late-game changes of [i]form[/i]. There's a top-down level like in Super C. Like in Super C, it's the easiest and least engaging one. It's about four years long, fairly uneventful and absolutely the weakest part of the game. Unlike in Super C, it shows up as the [i]sixth[/i] and penultimate stage, by which point it comes as an unwelcome and unnecessary bait-'n'-switch, killing any feeling of mounting intensity as you approach the finale. Other formal surprises fare much better, however, like the branching paths in stage 5 - one leading to a miniboss and the other to a tricky gauntlet - which genuinely add to its replay value.

The length can be exhausting not just in stage 6 but also the final stage, and the developers knew this, because they gave both of them checkpoints, which aren't used anywhere else. And while they might reduce the amount of time you spend wrestling with these levels, they don't necessarily make things easier, since they can lock you beyond the point at which you could grab your preferred weapon (although, fair play, the spread shot is always available for the last boss).

For me, Contra games are at their best when they're short and sweet. Five stages, around twenty minutes from beginning to end. Even for an experienced player blowing through it on a single life, Super Cyborg clocks in at a whopping fifty minutes (at least). That's an incredibly long time for any arcade-style game, and even titans like Radiant Silvergun and Gradius V don't necessarily [i]get away[/i] with being this protracted. Thankfully, Super Cyborg manages to remain engaging and exciting for most of its hefty duration – outside stage 6 there's no dead time, no wasted space.

In spite of these minor complaints, I really think you ought to play this game. It captures so much of what makes the Contra games exciting and addictive, and manages not only to emulate their unique flow but to escalate and build upon it, creating many moments of electrifying tension and payoff. It's exceedingly formidable, to be sure, but it's a game that gets more and more enjoyable the more you get to know it - you start off floundering spasmodically and swearing you could never make any headway through [i]this[/i] mess, and before long you're effortlessly dispatching hordes of hapless nightmare-mutants with a cocksure swagger. Blowing through all of the early stages without breaking a sweat on subsequent runs through them is an immensely rewarding experience, and you'll be doing it sooner than you might think. Super Cyborg doesn't have an original bone in its body, but it doesn't wish for one. It just wants to be a barnstorming Contra game, and it is!

31732464.review:
I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who misses those kinds of moments that have been far too rare since 4th-gen consoles and pre-Windows computers were discontinued:

-That moment when you pat yourself on the back for getting just a little farther than last time.
-That moment when you groan silently because you didn't get quite as far as last time.
-That moment when you hit yourself for repeating the same thing that you thought would work out but that got you killed over and over.
-That moment when you jump for joy as you finally reach a checkpoint.
-That moment when you look in the manual (here, card list) to find the name of that thing that kept killing you, as well as some fun facts about it.
-That moment when you curse the game as it suddenly gets much more difficult.
-That moment when you watch the crumbling stronghold of evil and the names of the game's developers scrolling by to triumphant music and decide to see if you can do it again on a harder difficulty.
-That moment when you watch the last, incredibly hard boss begin its death animation on the hardest difficulty after not continuing since stage 1 and wonder what all this was for and now what.

Including those who bid good riddance to the following moments about the same time:

-That moment when something genuinely random or unpredictable ruins your run.
-That moment when you have to start over from level 1 because you lost all your continues or your parents are calling you down for dinner.
-That moment when you have to play the whole game over, possibly without continuing but inevitably on a harder difficulty, to fight the true final boss and get the good ending.

31711985.review:
TL;DR - If you love Contra and/or Contra-esque games, you'll [i]immediately[/i] fall in love with Super Cyborg from the moment you fire it up.

[h1]Gameplay - 10/10 - Difficult, yet Fair.[/h1]
Don't be dissuaded by the difficulty. Contra is difficult, but can sometimes be unfair. This however is simply a matter of recognizing enemy patterns, boss attack patterns, where upgrades show up, and so on. Like Contra, but with plenty of time to make a move.

[h1]Graphics - 10/10 - Phenominal for the theme it's trying to use.[/h1]
The mishmash of colors, the simple yet easily recognizable sprites.. This game pulls off the 16-bit look almost [i]perfectly[/i]. NES, eat your heart out.

[h1]Audio - 8/10 - Gunplay and MDs are a smidge too loud.[/h1]
Basically, the music fits the era. However, the weapon and monster death sounds drown a lot of it out, making it hard to enjoy.

[h1]Controls - 10/10 - Great, but 'Lock' could use a revamp.[/h1]
The controls are tight, responsive, and very easy to figure out. 

[b]EDIT: Apparently, you [i]can[/i] change the lock function to 'hold'! Go into your options, and where it says 'LOCK - SWITCH', hit the right key and it changes to 'LOCK - HOLD'. My bad![/b]

[b]To put it simply, Super Cyborg is one of the best-looking, best-playing games I have seen in a long while. And that's not something I say often.[/b]

Now, back to my Level 2 attempt..

31582796.review:
I'm a major fan of the Contra series. I loved the series since I was a child and, unlike most people, I stuck with it as it aged. Contra: Shattered Soldier on Playstation 2 is still one of the greatest games I've ever played. The entries afterward were mostly excellent as well (except Hard Corps Uprising, which was a disaster).

The series left a legacy for anyone inspired to make side-scrolling action games. Sadly, a lot of them end up feeling hollow, uninspired, or just plain terrible (like 8-bit Commando). But that's not what we're talking about, this is about a game that's clearly inspired from Contra but still manages to beat a unique rhythm.

Super Cyborg feels like it was designed to play like Super C (hence the name), but takes a lot of enemy design and environment inspiration from Contra Hard Corps on Sega Genesis. Enemy designs are very interesting and somewhat gross, considering the NES aesthetic. Controls are fluid and feel great with a wired 360-controller, and the game itself is still very challenging! But it doesn't feel unfair. Just like with the Contra series, it can be frustrating but becomes very satisfying when you learn the game more and more.

I highly recommend this for folks that are looking to play a good Contra-esque game on PC.

29420686.review:
[h1]Super Cyborg[/h1]
Super Cyborg ist ein oldscool 2D Action Platfformer à la Contra für den NES. 

Das [b]Gameplay[/b] ist simpel wie damals. Man lartscht und springt durch ein 2D Level und ballert dabei mit allem wass man hat sämtliche Gegner nieder. Dabei gibt es PowerUps, die eine Modifikation an der eigenen Waffe vornehmen und diese verstärken. 

Die [b]Steuerung[/b] ist gelungen. Laufen, Ducken, den Diagonalen Schuss locken. Die Entwickler haben an alles gedacht, um ein gutes Erlebnis zu garantieren. 

[b]Grafik und Sound[/b] erinnern an die alten Contra Spiele. Stimmige und actionreiche 8Bit Musik sorgen für die Stimmung. Die schön gespritete Landschaft und Gegner mit biomechanischem Look sorgen für ein stranges aber spannendes Alien-Feeling. 

[b]Optionen[/b] bietet das Spiel die übliche Palette. Audio, Grafik, Steuerung und Controllersupport, welcher aber erst im Menü ausgewählt werden muss. 

[b]Spielzeit[/b] kann sehr variieren, je nachdem, wie viel Geduld man hat und Frust erträgt. 

[b]Das grosse Aber![/b]
Das Spiel ist deutlich zu schwer. Selbst der Schwierigkeitsgrad Einfach macht es nicht besser. Man hat 4 Treffer zu Gute, danach beginnt man das Level von vorne. 
Powerups, welche dass Spiel erleichtern sollten, verliert man bereits nach einem Hit. 
Schlimm ist dies aber nur, weil es z.T keine einzige Fläche auf dem Screen gibt, wo man nicht getroffen wird. Ohne einen Infinite Life Hack ist das Spiel einfach kaum für nicht Hardcore Player spielbar. 
Es ist einfach zu frustrierend, wenn man 2 Stunden zocken muss, um die ersten drei Level zu schaffen. Ohne mehreren Dutzend Stunden, wird man das Spiel auf normalen Wege kaum durchspielen können. 
Man sieht dies bereits an den Globalen Errungenschaftsstatistiken. Die meisten schaffen nicht einmal das erste Level. 
Auch manche Erungenschaften sind viel zu schwer und kaum erreichbar.

[b]Fazit[/b]
Super Cyborg ist ein wirklich gutes Spiel, wenn man extrem frustresistent ist und man mehrere Stunden am gleichen Level sitzen kann. Das Spiel ansich, d.h das Gameplay, Sound, Grafik, Leveldesign etc. ist wirklich gut. Es ist leider nur viel zu schwer und für die wenigsten Spieler geeignet.
Wer also auf knallharte 2D Balleraction, mit liebevoll geestallteten, crazy Gegnern in unwirklichen Leveln steht, wird mit dem Spiel wirklich Spass haben. Der Preis von 5 CHF/Euro ist gerechtfertigt. 
Auch wenn der hohe Schwierigkeitsgrad ein grosses Contra ist ;D, gebe ich [b]eine Kaufempfgehlung[/b].

29325541.review:
It's basically a Contra ripoff, but man what a ripoff. It has everything Contra had to offer. It plays like Contra. It looks like Contra. It's much more difficult then Contra. But difficulty is very fair - every fault is yours and you are the only one to blame (except the last boss, man f**k this mf'er). The game is kinda short, but Contra games were short too due to their arcade coin-hungry design. So if you have cravings for a hardcore 8bit run'n'gun game - here it is. And there is nothing on Steam to beat it.
Music is awesome, gameplay is polished and controls are rock solid. It supports direct-input gamepads, have remapping feature and also devs fixed Xbox gamepad's issues so you can play hassle-free with those too. There is local coop if you have some bats**t insane friend. There is also an online coop if you have bats**t insane online friend. You can even customize colours of your cyborg.
Art is a bit amateurish, but that's the only con of the game. Sometimes it's straight up toxic, but readability of environments/enemies/projectiles are still good. So gameplay wise it's okay. On the other hand you get much more organic designs than original Contra - more in a vein of Hard Corps or Contra 3.

p.s.: you actually can play as human commando hunks. But you have to beat the game... And in order to beat the game you have to bring out your inner japanese - the game is WAY harder than any Contra game (basically on a same difficulty level as Shattered Soldier).

Признаюсь, после первой пары часов игры я хотел ей влепить жирный дислайк, но в моих правилах выбивать все ачивки (по крайней мере старатся) и это очень сильно пошло мнению об игре на пользу.
Но обо всём по порядку.
Судя по названию эта игра должна быть клоном Super C, так знакомой многим еще с детства. Хотя графически игра мне как-то больше похожа на turbographx 16 ну и палитра местами довольно кислотная. Первый уровень во многом напоминает джунгли из третьего уровня Супер контры, да и музычка в нём очень даже хороша. Оружия точно такие же, разве что F поменяли на E, но сути это не меняет и еще добавили чардж для каждого ствола.  Второй уровень тоже чем-то смахивает на вертикальный из той же игры, только музыка начинает подводить. А вот с третьего начинаеться жопа. Игра резко прибавляет в сложности, враги начинают адово переть изо всех щелей и босса с первого раза вряд-ли кому-то удастся одолеть. Дальше только хуже...
Играл я на максимально доступном нормале, поэтому решил перейти на изи для тренировок, но игра легче не стала, ну разве что на практически незаметную малость, поэтому пришлось потеть. Super Cyborg даже на изи сложнее любой НЕС-овской контры в разы. И вот это считаю косяком, ибо так игра не должна унижать практически со старта. А уж последний уровень (особенно лифт) с жесточайшим боссом в конце это вообще отдельная история, на него у вас уйдет МНОГО попыток, я вам гарантирую. Я бы мог конечно описать происходящий там звиздец, но не хочу спойлерить.
Но, вот когда я всё таки преодолел игру в первый раз и принялся за неё вновь, она мне начала нравится гораздо больше и что самое интересное, с каждым следующим прохождением она меня всё больше радовала. В игре довольно неплохие ачивки (кроме парочки), которые заставят вас неплохо изучить и задрочить игру. Да и после первого-второго прохождения даже на изи, уже и хард не покажется неприступным (хотя там своих "сюрпризов" добавилось порядочно).
Ну а теперь плюсы и минусы и финальный вердикт:

+ Знакомая механика, за которой я уже успел соскучится, ведь Contra 4 и Hardcorps Uprising были довольно давно.
+ Игра даёт неплохой вызов и если вы перетерпите все невзгоды, то получите тонны фана
+ Не лагающий онлайн мультиплеер
+ Неплохие боссы

+/- Музыка - местами она очень радует (1-й, 4-й уровень, тема финального босса и концовки) в других уровнях как-то средненько, у Даркмена есть и получше треки (но это на вкус и цвет конечно)
+/- Изи сложноват для первого ознакомления, я думаю можно было бы добавить еще вери изи для нубов (на которой не открываются ачивки и нет полной концовки или босса\уровня, такое практиковалось в некоторых играх серии Contra), потому что не у всех есть терпение выучивать игру.
+/- Графика - она неплохая, но не совсем в моем вкусе. Хотя концовка отлично нарисована.

- ачивка Bodyguard и golden cyborg - не у каждого под боком найдется такой же идиот который сможет тащить эту игру да еще и без смертей и стрельбы, но идея прикольная. Так же не каждый захочет проходить игру 3-4 раза подряд без сливов.
- Странно, но персонаж не умеет спрыгивать с платформ, хотя в любой игре серии Контра персонажи могли это делать. Не то чтобы это большая необходимость при здешних уровнях, но пару раз мне бы это не помешало.

Итог: Хорошая фанатская игра, уж всяко лучше разнообразных неадекватных хаков. 8 из 10 и рекомендации для всех фанатов олдскулла.

24382060.review:
Not long ago, Yacht Club Games (the creators of Shovel Knight) held a poll for what style of game they should create next. Most of the options were typical and included things such as Shovel Knight 2,  a Metroid, a Mega Man, and a Super Mario RPG.  One of the options really stood out to me, the “a Contra” option.  Years ago I spent a lot of time playing Contra, Super C, Contra III: Alien Wars, and Contra: Shattered Soldier.  Run and gun side scrolling shooters were a staple of my gaming diet.  When I saw a Contra style game as an option in the poll, I realized that I haven't played any in a long time.  After searching around on the internet I found Super Cyborg on Steam.

First and foremost I'll say that I'm saddened I didn't find more of this type of game.  Perhaps it shouldn't be surprising, after all Contra games are renowned for their difficulty level. Second, I'll say that what little I found is solid.  Super Cyborg, does more than evoke nostalgia of Contra, for better or worse Super Cyborg is Contra.  If it were the early 90s and you walked up to me, handed me an NES cartridge of Super Cyborg and said, “Hey check this out, it's Contra 3!” I'd probably have believed you after playing it.  Super Cyborg recreates the Contra experience to such an extent that it feels almost like a long lost game.

Super Cyborg wears its influences on its sleeve.  Right at the start of the game. the character drops out of an aircraft into a jungle.  The action starts shortly after hitting the ground.  Power-ups float by that you can shoot down for alternate weapons such as spread shot, laser shot, machine gun, and rapid fire.  Your character does spinning flips upon pressing jump.  Groups of enemies run and jump straight at you, sometimes coming from both sides of the screen.  The bosses are grotesquely mutated aberrations.  You die in a single hit.  Sound familiar?

While the similarities are clear, not everything is the same.  One notable difference is that it is not possible to drop down through platforms by holding down and pressing jump.  There is also a save game feature that allows you to start at the beginning of the last stage you entered.  You can expect to die a lot, but you effectively have infinite continues here.  It's nice because you don't have to beat the game in one sitting, though I'm sure you could if you really wanted.  The last difference that comes to mind is the ability to charge shots and lock yourself into a stationary position while firing.  It was only possible to do this in later Contra titles.  The ability to drop through platforms isn't particularly important due to the way stages were designed, and the other changes/additions are welcome.

At the end of the day, Super Cyborg isn't the most innovative game.  It might lose points for not being particularly original or creative, but it is still a very solid Contra-esque game.  Darkman007's tracks sound great, and the sprites look even better than the hideous mutated freaks could reasonably hope.  It isn't hard to see that Artur Games put a lot of time an effort to make the most faithful “modern-retro” Contra they could develop.  It all pays off, Super Cyborg works well.  It's very easy for me to recommend Super Cyborg to any fans of the classic Contra games and also to people that haven't played them yet but have an interest.  Artur Games has managed to breath life into what sadly appears to be a dying genre, now only if someone can convince them to make a Metal Slug game.

23898402.review:
ビックリする程FC版Super魂斗羅。

ステージ構成も敵の挙動もSuper魂斗羅。パワーアップアイテムもSuper魂斗羅。
BGMの雰囲気や効果音もSuper魂斗羅。ジャンプ中のフワっとした感触がSuper魂斗羅。
敵弾の小ささと見難さもSuper魂斗羅。

ボスの攻撃を避ける時の遊びが少なく、攻撃が来る前に避け動作に入っていないと死ぬ感触がSuper魂斗羅。
初見殺しが1ステージ3回以上あり1度のプレイではほぼ絶対クリアできず、何度も何度もステージ頭から再開させられるのがSuper魂斗羅。
自ショットの当たり判定が小さく連射が遅く、敵を飛び越えざまに真下撃ちした時にショットが敵に当たらない時があり、着地時に死ぬ感触もSuper魂斗羅。
小さな足場渡りで死んだ時にどこに自分が復活したか見つける前に無敵時間が切れて敵に当たって死ぬ感触まで完全にSuper魂斗羅。

今となっては不快なこれら細かい仕様まで完全コピーする必要があるのか首を傾げてしまうが、これもSuper魂斗羅愛のなせる業なのだと思う。

仕様の違いはデフォルトで連射付き、魂斗羅スピリッツのように斜角固定ボタンがあるのと、溜め撃ちがある事、全体の難度がSuper魂斗羅より高めで、4面ボス以降から難度曲線が急激に上がる事。

ステージクリア時にセーブされ次回プレイ時にそこから再スタートできるのは昔より親切だが、ご丁寧に残機も保存してくれるので、攻略時に3機以下で再開するとまず残機を全部潰してコンティニューしなければいけないのが今作られたゲームとして非常に中途半端。
ここまでSuper魂斗羅が好きならセーブなど付けなくてもよかったのではないかと思ったりする。

Super魂斗羅が好きで、今Super魂斗羅を遊びたい「熱い斗魂とゲリラ戦術の素質を先天的に合わせ持つ最強の闘士」にお奨めしたい。

22339867.review:
在看正文评测前，请允许我先把时间倒回到上世纪九十年代末，做一段简短的回忆。
一台小霸王，两个方方正正的手柄，一台CRT球面屏幕电视，以及几张黄色外壳的游戏卡，基本是80后游戏玩家人生里的标准配置。嗯，当然，我家那时候也有这些。在那个游戏还没有被扣上“洪水猛兽”“电子海洛因”这些令人畏而远之的大帽子之前，媒体主流的说法还是“电子游戏有益智力”，所以我家父母也就“不惜重金”地购入了一台。于是，每次到周末或者寒暑假的时候，我家都会变成一群大孩子小孩子聚集的窝点。
“我来！我来！”
“你大爷的不准抢一人一条命！”
“我操打他！打那个地方！我操又死了！”
“换个游戏！这个不好玩！”
“不准拖我啊啊啊又把我拖死了！你别跳那么快！”
“别借我命了我命都给你借没了！”
“……”
我不知道这些对话能勾起多少人的童年回忆，但至少我家三姐妹的童年是一直在这样吵吵闹闹中过去的。顺便借评测骂那些儿时的小伙伴几句，为啥我们家的游戏机我们姐妹三个基本都没怎么玩到啊？我们家真的不是游戏厅啊！T_T

……
[h1]【Will some other unknown evil attack earth in the future?】
【Is it the end of Red Falcon?】
【We will never know.】
【But one thing is certain!】

【If you want peace, DON'T MESS WITH THE CONTRAS!】[/h1]

什么鬼的Super Cyborg，这根本就是魂斗罗有木有！[strike]连标题字体都是扒的魂斗罗和超级魂斗罗有木有！[/strike][spoiler]隐藏人物就是魂斗罗有木有有木有！[/spoiler]

剧情：剧情？这游戏还有剧情？哦，剧情好像在商店详情页里写了。嗯，这种东西没有又怎样？只要一路拿着枪突突突然后一路对着异形们秀体操跳跃动作就好了嘛。
嘛，还是提一提吧，其实你把魂斗罗的剧情改改名字就行啦——异形又出现在某个岛屿抢占了人类基地，然后两猛人（猛机器人？）空降岛上一路火力全开把异形们打得跪地求饶各种gg，嗯，大概如此。是不是和魂斗罗完全一样？
评价：3/10

图像和音效：标准的2D像素风，图像就是各种颜色的小方块。当然，图像颜色深度比魂斗罗的16色还是要强很多的。而且由于帧数的上升，人物Sprite的各种动作都可以用更多帧来表现，一定程度上也使得动作流畅了很多。声音方面同上，复古的电子MIDI风加上充满着模拟音源电音感的音效。作为一个强调复古风的游戏，声画内容的表现还算良好。在Sprite设计上，怪物和角色的设计容易让人想到GENESIS主机上的腐尸之屋（SPLATTER HOUSE）系列，但在某些地方上还能看得出稚嫩之处，比如boss身上经常出现的描黑边习惯（这是做像素图新手常犯的毛病）以及一些颜色块过渡比较生硬等。爆炸特效容易让人想起SFC上的魂斗罗3（魂斗罗异形战争），但是动态设计做得要好多了。
评价：6/10

上手性和可玩性：手感很好地还原了魂斗罗，但易上手，难精通。本作比起魂斗罗来最大的特点就是弱化了玩家火力，强化了敌兵刷新数量，而且还放大了玩家身体的判定面积。在同样的情况下，你在魂斗罗里能打到的敌人，在本作时常会打不到；而你在魂斗罗里能轻松躲开的敌人在本作很可能会送你下黄泉。敌兵会跳，会选择路线追杀玩家，炮台类敌目标锁定玩家的动作也更敏捷，敌弹速度更快……总之比魂斗罗的难度提升了不只一点二点。不过，和魂斗罗差不多的是，你仍旧可以靠背地图来记住整个游戏的攻略方法（除了随机出现的杂兵），所以，多练习吧。
[h1]友情提示：武器的蓄力攻击一定要学会使用，因为不管什么枪普通射击的伤害都无比感人。[/h1]
评价：6/10

优化：手机轻松高特效级别，谈不上什么优化不优化的。
评价：-/10

其他：
[list]
[*]魂斗罗的2D硬派手感完美还原。加分。
[*]能联机游玩，而且联机很方便，同时还可以保存联机存档以便日后再战。加分。
[*]怀旧属性满载。隐藏人物和隐藏秘技都在向魂斗罗致敬。加分。
[*]全成就相对比较现实，成就难度在Steam里算是刚好合适。加分。
[*]原声音乐不算好听，听时间长了会觉得很烦躁。减分。
[*]控制器和按钮设置不合理处颇多，例如没有备用键位选择，以及不能自动识别手柄控制必须手动调整等。减分。
[*]角色被弹判定面积大得坑爹以至于特别容易被杀（敌人的判定却很小）。减分。
[*]默认的机器人设计得有点丑。减分。
[/list]


[h1]总结：怀旧系小品级作品，怀旧或者有爱者可入，无爱者可忽略。

推荐度：★★★☆/★★★★★（较推荐）[/h1]

最后加一句：本作如果支持创意工坊的话，成为神作的概率估计会大幅上升。

21746714.review:
Игра представляет из себя тупой клон контры, из названия можно понять, что конкретно второй части на NES. Начнем по порядку. 
Геймплей в осном копирует оригинал, у нас есть бравый солдат(в данном случае киборг), без всякого посвящения в сюжет нас бросают в джунгли, где нам предстоит мочить всех направо и налево. Есть несколько видов оружия, это Spreadgun, Machinegun, Laser, Energygun(который в оригинале Flame Thrower) и дефолтное. Потеря оружия сулит вам нелегкую жизнь, а все из-за того, что дефолтное оружие максимально ущербное. Так же, у каждого оружия есть чардж, но забудьте о нем, абсолютно бесполезная хрень. Пока его заряжаете, враг сможет вас сто раз убить. 
Начиная с третьего, уровни построены на меморайзинге(запоминании), если не знать что делать в конкретном месте и не выработать тактику, то это неминуймая смерть. Явно чувствуется что разраб не умеет в сложность, по этому вместо того, чтобы придумывать что то интересное, решил запилить тупую зубрежку маршрутов. Допустим, перед суббоссом 3 уровня есть подъем, на котором сидит лягушка, сверху висит турелька, а сзади бегут враги. И угол наклона у склона такой, что ты не можешь попасть по этой лягушке стреляя по диагонали, если у тебя не оружие S. По этому приходится успевать уничтожить турельку, отстреливаться от врагов сзади и как то в прыжке успеть убить лягушку, а она жирная и быстро приблежается. Пока не вырабаешь тактику на это место, тебя будут убивать. Это самый безобидный пример, дальше в уровнях столько меморазинга(особенно в последнем), что умирать вы будете постоянно, даже на легком уровне сложности. При этом не всегда понимая, либо это разраб криворукий, запилил кучу врагов и пуль, от которых не увернуться без тактики, либо это ваши крывые руки. После прохождения игры я понял, что первое. 
Боссы это отдельная тема. Все они сделаны по тому же принципу, что и уровни. Знаешь тактику, знаешь в каком пикселе тебе находиться чтобы не умерет, боссы умирают очень быстро. При этом поведение их весьма загадочное. Допустим, берем опять 3 уровень, только теперь уже босса. Вторая его форма это какой то треш. Пока не потратишь реально конта 3-4, не поймешь, куда ему надо стрелять и, самое главное, как это сделать. Ведь когда босс прыгает, он наводится на тебя, тебе приходиться уворачиваться и бежать направо, чтобы не умереть. Вот объясните мне как нормально в него стрелять в этот момент? Приходиться изворачиваться и маленькими очередями его дамажить.
И вот плавно мы подходим к главному косяку игры. Это последний подъем на лифте к последнему боссу и, собственно, сам последний босс. АБСОЛЮТНО ВСЕ В ЭТОМ МЕСТЕ ПОСТОЕННО НА ЗАПОМИНАНИИ. Это полный треш, никто, подчеркиваю, НИКТО не сможет пройти лифт без потерь жизней с первого раза. У последнего босса 4 формы. Но самая трешовая это первая. Босс начинает срать на вас сверху какими то тентаклямы заполоняющими все пространство между лифтом и боссом, которые надо отстреливать. При это в рандомном месте вылезает супер тентакля, которую надо завалить. Как только вы ее отстрелите, на ее месте начнет капать кислота. И так надо отстрелить абсолютно все тентакли. Если не знать тактику, каким образом от всего этого уворячивать, то это неминуемая смерть. Вы будуте тратить конт за контом, пока не выучите наизусть тактику. Именно из-за этой формы полгода назад я забросил игру. Потому что это верх трешовости, разработчик намеренно сделал последнего босса мегасложным, чтобы его игрой обмазывались как можно дольше. Причем это очень дешевая сложность, интересного в этом ничего нету. Ты просто запоминаешь в каком пикселе в какой момент тебе стоять, чтобы не умереть. И все. 
Так же хочу отметить, что уровни сложности отличаются только кол-вом здоровья боссов и некоторых врагов, каких то новых интересных паттернов вы не увидите. 
В итоге, максимум чего заслуживает эта игра это 4 из 10. И то только из-за музыки и графики. Хотя видно что кто то очень сильно любит палитру fceultra, слишком много необоснованно ярких цветов. Совсем не понимаю этого фанбойства в обзорах. Ведь оригинальные контры не были настолько плохо сделаными, в них все было сбалансированно и любили мы их именно за это.

21113181.review:
Greatest Contra clone/Spiritual sequel. It takes a lot from both Contra & Super C with a spice of HardCorps and Shattered Soldier. The overall level design follows the Super C template with a little bit of HC influence as you will be facing bosses about 2 or 3 times a stage. the Shattered Soldier influence comes with the chargeable weapon which gives a strategic element to know which weapon to use at what time and when it is better to simply tap'n'leave with a Charge shot rather than fire at will. The patterns for the bosses are mostly inspired by HC, which feel a bit unbalanced at times since you don't have the abilities needed, but it comes out as a NES-Hard difficulty where you either man up and do a perfect run or you simply won't make it. The last boss is incredibly hard. I'd recommend this game in a Heartbeat to any old-school Contra fan, especialñly if you liked Contra/Super C/Hardcorps/Shattered Soldier over any other installment. 

[b] TL;DR If you're an oldschool Contra fan, you better get this game immediately (it is currently bundled for 1.99 on bundlestars and is frequently bundled in other bundle sites as well)[/b]

9/10 Would Lock n' Load and Attack Aggressively again.

21056920.review:
Не стал что либо высказывать на тему этой игры пока не прошел.

Сегодня я её сломал, и что могу сказать?

Великолепно и замечательно постарались Артур и Даркман007.
Да эту игру сделали наши ребята, а это значит что таланты у нас есть в стране, просто им нет продвижения, на протяжении многих лет наш игропром клепал всякое дерьмо изредка выстреливая чем нибудь годным, вроде Блицкрига.

Но разница в том, что это детище, творение любителей частников, одержимых идеей возродить классическую серию Greyzor.

Что же мы имеем?

Скролл шут эм ап, усовершенствованный и доработанный, но в отличии от всяких ремастеров и переизданий, или фанатских подделок, эта вещь смогла:
- Сохранить классический геймплей Greyzor ( Ну ладно, если хотите Super Contr`ы )
- Доработать и внести изменения: переработать баланс оружия, добавить альтернативный вид огня.
- Сделать кроссовер Европейской Contra и Американской Probotector
- Доработать и придумать новых боссов с хорошими паттернами, в меру сложных и самое главное интересных.

И многое другое.
Нет смысла все расписывать, надо попробовать самому, вот только вряд ли нынешнее поколение поймет и прочувствует.

Ну что тут добавить? Никаких отклонений от сюжета, все новое отлично вписалось в атмосферу классики которую бережно перенесли и сохранили, вместе со сложностью конечно же.
У сударя Артура достаточно хорошая фантазия, дизайн уровней великолепен. И пусть некоторые спрайты взяты из других проектов, и перерисованы, но это никак не мешает ( ну может мне показалось? Но спрайт Киборга и его анимация точно скопированы )

За музыку отдельное спасибо Даркману007, косвенно которого знаю, талантливый музыкантище.

Вообщем подводя итоги скажу одно, серию удалось возродить, и получилось это сногсшибательно, не побоюсь этого слова.

Подчеркну, это не клон, это не подделка, это совершенно новая часть Contra, которая достойна внимания каждого ностальгирующего задрота, каждого олдфага.
Если вы являетесь таковым, ни в коем случае нельзя это пропускать.

Личная оценка 10 из 10.

А напоследок хочется пожелать Артуру, сделать продолжение в виде более обширной компании, с новыми фишками, на манер классического Грейзора с феньками в виде интермишнов и миникарты и прочими косметическими прелестями, сохраняя классический геймплей.
Ну и конечно же удачи в игроиздании и игрострое.
Надеюсь парнишка не закопает свой талант в землю.

Однозначно Мастхев.

This is my first Steam review, so I'll keep it short and sweet for now...

Hats off to Artur Games for a job well done on both the game and its soundtrack. I'll have y'all know right now that Contra is one of my top favorite game franchises, and for a clone that actually pays homage, it gets the formula just right. 20520796.review:
To note, the first game I ever beat on one quarter and one life in the arcade was Contra.  I have enjoyed the Contra series until it moved to Playstation 1 and they started to go off the deep end by confusing collossal and impressive with cartoon comical.  Now, the arcade contra series had a particular nuance in the gun firing control which was interesting and frustrating at the same time.  The NES one- is the one that I believe truly put Contra on the map of every young person who owned the nintendo at that time.  Coop became a 'thing.'  Large bosses became a 'thing.'  Punishing one hit deaths and getting rick rolled by a game became a 'thing.'

Fast forward to this game:
This game has too many human looking eyeballs :P However, overlooking this, it is perfect and I mean perfect in the feel and control of the game to match and duplicate the Nintendo Contra.  Not the later series ones, but the solid NES control and feel.

The game has some of the BEST and imaginative boss fights in a side scrolling shooter I have ever played.  It is worth it to play through the game JUST to get to these fights.  Also be very glad the guns are all auto-fire- especially for the later stages and last bosses.  Unlike many of the Contra games, especially the arcade Super Contra, losing your power ups does not mean you cannot survive the game.  The default gun is great and has a solid ROF.

This game has coop and netplay.  What can I say here, this is excellent.

I will say that some elements of some of the levels are a bit bland and could use some enhancements.  However, you WILL overlook this as you go on further in the game.  Personally, level 3 was the least impressive to me and I WISH it had a lot more environmental terrors in it and that the mid boss played a bit differently.  This is minor though and borders on nitpicking haha

To sum up:
- excellent control, truly an inspired sequel to the first NES Contra titles (Contra and Super C), with some additions to control that make it pro player on every level (ability to fire at angles in a locked standing position for example).

Get this game, support the developers- I would love a sequel :D

19753432.review:
Молодцы ребята. Весьма грамотный 8-way shooter, прям клон старой доброй Контры. По сравнению с OniKen и Insanity's Blade эта игра канонична на все 100%. Есть несколько вещей к которым можно придраться, но те две игры и в подметки не годятся. Вобщем, властью, данной мне 25-летним игровым стажем, объявляю Super Cyborg самой каноничной 8-битной игрой 2015 года. Молодцы. Артур (так и хочется добавить "Пирожков") и Darkman007 просто красавчики. Четко. Пацаны ваще ребята.

Бочку меда портят несколько вещей:
1 - прыжок. Иногда с задержкой. И раз уж у вас нет турбокнопок, можно сделать регистрацию прыжка сразу по приземлению, когда в воздухе кнопку прыжка перенажимаешь. Т.е. нажал первый раз - персонаж подпрыгнул, отпустил-нажал еще раз - персонаж подпрыгивает сразу же после приземления.
2 - стрельба тоже не каноничная. В оригинале было ограниченное кол-во снарядов, за счет чего имело смысл расстреливать боссов вплотную. Тот же шотган (без турбокнопки) позволял делать два полных залпа в разных направлениях почти одновременно. У вас же он вышел как парализованый.
3 - графон. Все красиво, но было бы гораздо лучше, не будь уровни такими пестрыми, порой теряешь противников на его фоне (мухи на втором уровне). А с этой прозрачностью при возрождении иногда и персонажа своего теряешь.
4 - возрождение. Почему после возрождения персонаж не падает сверху экрана? У такого поведения была своя функция. Ты сразу же видишь положение своего персонажа и не теряешь его в толпе. А уж с этой прозрачностью на пестром фоне...
5 - от менюшек в глазах рябит. Меньше всех этих детализаций с dither'ом. Я понимаю все эти фишки с "полутонами", но такие области не должны быть слишком обширными. И слишком много движения в меню, совсем не по 8-битному.
6 - склоны. Персонажи по ним бегут по диагонали с соотношением 1:2, угол стрельбы же не меняется - 1:1. В Супер Контре угол стрельбы в этот момент тоже меняется на 1:2 как раз что бы избежать проблем с прицеливанием по бегущим на тебя противникам.

The most beautiful and smooth Contra clone I've ever played. The style of the game is based mostly off of the NES Contra games, but uses Contra 3 firing rules (every weapon is autofire, so no blistered thumbs) with an extra weapon charge button like Contra: Shattered Soldier. Lets you choose between BOTH types of player locking (The one from Contra 3+Contra 4+ Contra ReBirth where you hold the button, but also has the toggleable lock from Shattered Soldier if you really want to use that garbage). The laser weapon is kind of a mixture of Contra 3 and Contra 4's laser, so it isn't underpowered. Most enemies are weird and mutated things that look like something out of Contra Hard Corps. This game really tries to combine all contra games into one experience, and even has local co-op and netplay. My one complaint is that you can't jump down off of platforms (down+jump).

By the way, if and when you get this game, go straight into options and immediately turn smoothing off, because it looks awful.

Llegué a este juego de casualidad y lo compré por un precio irrisorio. Ha sido uno de las mejores compras en mucho tiempo. He disfrutado un montón con él y me ha dado varias horas de diversión (y de cabreos). Y las que me dará, porque es uno de esos títulos que, si te gusta el género, vuelves a rejugar de vez en cuando.

Básicamente Super Cyborg es un "Run and Gun" al estilo clásico. Un clon de Contra / Probotector, sí, pero un clon bien hecho. A mi personalmente me recuerda al de NES, que jugué en su época.

Los gráficos son pixel art, con un paleta de colores algo peculiar. Los diseños de los enemigos, particularmente los jefes, son muy ochenteros: mutantes asquerosos, lleno de vísceras y fluidos, que parecen salidos de las más horribles pesadillas de una mente retorcida. Una pasada.

La música es chiptune y los sonidos recuerdan bastante a la ya mencionada saga Contra.

La jugabilidad está bastante lograda. El control, una vez más, recuerda al clásico de Konami. Pero ojo, nos encontramos ante un juego MUY DIFÍCIL, que incluso en su modo de dificultad fácil te hace pasarlo mal. Y que cuenta, además, con dos niveles extra de dificultad. Cabreos y palabrotas asegurados jugando a Super Cyborg.

En conclusión, un muy digno clon que hará disfrutar a los seguidores de este género y que nos devuelve a la saga mítica de Konami, algo que la propia compañia nipona nunca volverá a hacer.

18388701.review:
For those who haven't heard of this one, it's a blatant [i]Contra[/i] clone.  It's very much patterned on the original NES games, not so much the SNES/Genesis ones.  At least in terms of playstyle.  The [i]bosses[/i], however, are very much the sort of multi-form monstrosities you'd expect from modern-day [i]Contra[/i].  Well, as modern as it gets, considering Konami has left the main franchise fallow since [i]Contra 4[/i], which was also great stuff.  (There was [i]Contra: ReBirth[/i] and [i]Hard Corps Uprising[/i], but they feel more like side stories than proper entries in the series.)

So the nice thing is that you get infinite continues.  Hey, that's great!  Except the difficulty has been bumped up to account for that.  Expect to have to make quite a few runs at stages to get through them relatively unscathed on your lowly four-life complement.  Especially considering the way some stages throw enemies at you constantly, with the edges of the screen certain death.  The bosses also have some serious "gotcha" moves that will make you swear profusely at the game.

There's not much original in terms of weapon content.  You get a rapid shot (doubles shot speed), the machine gun and spreader are identical to [i]Contra[/i], the electric shot is identical to [i]Super C[/i]'s Flame shot, and the laser is an improved "won't disappear when I press the button again" gun that feels a bit like the lightning shot in [i]Gunstar Heroes[/i].  Heck, the game even throws a overhead-style stage in the vein of [i]Super C[/i] at you.  It, like those stages in [i]Super C[/i], aren't terribly difficult for the cautious.

It's the last boss that had me shaking at the end, though.  That thing has [i]four[/i] forms.  Four!  And while the game is nice enough to let you continue at the stage halfway point, getting to the last boss will take you a bunch of tries.  But even if you only get there with one life, it's just as well, because for most of the battle, if you lose the spreader, it's over.  Especially with the third form, because if you can't take one of the eyeballs out fast enough, they do some really tough attacks to dodge.  If you die after that, like I did, it's possible to make it through...  leading you to the last form, which reminds me a ton of having to do the Base 2 stage in [i]Contra[/i] with the floating bubble boss...  with only your peashooter.  Pull it off I did, though.  Thankfully, I had an extra life or two to get me through, but it's actually probably easier to pull off a perfect run...

Graphics and sound are pretty spiffy, very solid there.  The soundtrack has snatches of [i]Contra[/i], but also ends up having a Follin-esque sound at times, too.  I didn't have as much trouble as some mentioned with seeing shots, but the backgrounds are definitely very busy and colorful.

Play control is extremely tight.  No bugginess that I noticed, everything has a very cohesive feel, and it's all very well put together, if you can take the challenge.

Overall, I'm glad I bought it.  I'll probably never, ever play it again on account of the jitters I've already got...  but who knows?  I used to feel that way about the original [i]Contra[/i], and I play that a ton.  But this is [i]way[/i] harder than [i]Contra[/i], so be warned.

18364434.review:
It's the proper Contra sequel Konami doesn't want to make anymore.
You've got all the Super C weapons, the charge shot from Shattered Soldier and the ability to hold in place with a button like every game since Alien Wars (you can even change it to be like Hard Corps if for some weird reason you preferred it that way)
The difficulty is exactly what you would expect from a game like this and I never felt cheated by the game whenever I died, it was always a dumb mistake or not paying attention. I've seen people complain that you are helpless once you lose a special weapon but that is not the case at all, the default weapon is incredibly powerful when used properly.
There is a single minor flaw to the game: when you're on a slope and you shoot diagonally the aim will not realign itself to be at the proper angle like it does in every Contra game. I find it weird that the developer who obviously loves the series as much as he does could forget something like that but again it's a minor thing and its absense is only noticeable in a couple of spots.

If you've been craving some more Contra then you [u][i]need[/i][/u] this game.

关键字：魂斗罗、硬派、无伤通关、隐藏人物、40条命、选关。

类Konami《魂斗罗》的优秀作品。关卡与BOSS的设计很巧妙，非常耐玩。难度设定有点Capcom的风格，刚开始玩会觉得难度大，不过只要摸索出规律，完全可以做到无伤通关。

这是全BOSS战无伤视频：

画面和音乐表现平平。毕竟这只是3个人开发的独立游戏，能做到让《魂斗罗》的老玩家叫好，就已经很不容易了。不必苛求太多。

可惜关卡数量太少了，只有七关。玩的正High呢，突然就结束了。如果能做出传说中的水下八关，那就完美了。有几个成就的难度非常之高，喜欢接受挑战的玩家可以尝试一下。

下面介绍隐藏要素：

（1）隐藏人物和难度：Easy难度通关后可解锁隐藏人物，很像《魂斗罗》中的1P。Normal难度通关后可解锁Hard难度。

（2）40条命秘籍：左、左、右、右、上、下、下、上、下、跳、跳、跳（在标题画面正确输入上述秘籍后会听到一声特殊音效，再开始新游戏，就有40条命了）。

（3）选关秘籍：射击、跳、跳、蓄力射击、上、右、下、左、上、右、下、左（还是在标题画面中输入）

（4）选择武器秘籍：右、跳、左、跳、上、射击、上、射击、蓄力射击（在暂停菜单中输入）。

17901512.review:
I find it difficult to not recommend Super Cyborg because it's obviously a work of passion and a tribute to the old NES title 'Super Contra'

The graphics are suitably retro though they tend more to the garish EGA colours than the more muted NES pallette.  Turning off filtering and blending options gives a very old school emulated look that I find appealing.  The sprites are chunky and what they lack in style they make up for in character.  Curiously in this day-and-age the game is locked to a 4:3 ratio screen which leaves the borders black.

The music is generally good and has a remixed contra vibe going.  It doesn't quite have the presence of a lot of the late 80s games and as such is fairly forgettable; but this is not a significant criticism as it still suits the game.  The sound effects are very similar to Super Contra but - again - miss something vital and don't quite feel 'there'.

My biggest gripe is with the gameplay.  It's punishingly difficult in the later stages.  A frustration that's exacabated by the lack of a quick restart button.  Miss or lose a power up and that's the point at which the stage is failed, everything afterwards is just killing the player.

It's made more frustrating by a myriad of small differences from Super Contra.  Things that should have been fixed during playtesting.  The enemy bullets move too fast and being purple / yellow are difficult to spot agains purple or yellow backgrounds.  There are cheap deaths near the borders of the screen: enemies spawn underneath the player or shoot from outside the edges.  

Couple this with a lack of checkpoints in some very long stages and it's time to start throwing controllers.  

The controls are classic Contra though the player moves a bit more slowly than in the original.  The gun doesn't angle correctly up inclined platforms but this is hardly a problem.  What is a problem is that analogue controls on game controllers do not work; there is no diagonal fire with the analogue sticks.

To wrap this up.  If you're feeling nostalgic and want to mess around in a Super Contra like game for a couple of hours then buy Super Cyborg.  If you're looking for a platformer like Gryzor, Contra or Turrican then approach with caution; Super Cyborg is too frustrating to scratch that itch.

17650897.review:
Great game with greater difficulty. Super Cyborg is an action platformer in the vein of classics such as Contra. It requires quick reflexes but also patience because the difficulty as well as visual style are straight out of the S/NES playbook.

Tight controls, cruel deaths, evil levels & enemies and bosses you're gonna hate!
I really enjoyed the music and art too. It's recommended for those that can tolerate a difficult platformer, and by difficult i mean relentles. Paths and attacks can be memorised most of the time though there are a few enemies with random aim to throw the player off. Despite the onslaught of bullets and monsters to pay attention to, deaths very rarely feel cheap. Similarly to Volgarr the Viking, expect to repeat levels many times before becoming skilled enough to complete the game. And just completing one level feels like a big deal. Compared to Volgarr though, the pace of Super Cyborg is quicker, and difficulty maybe a touch easier. You'll still swear it's impossible many times.

I'm not very good at these games so i tend to hate them. Super Cyborg felt surprisingly encouraging. It's easy to play but everything kills in one hit so it's important to figure out how to deal with new enemies or sequences. The game stays fresh with new types of pain to put you through and even though i'd have to replay stages again and again, i was motivated to get through and see what the next pit of hell is gonna be like.

It's tough but fun, mostly because of really good gameplay/controls and a lack of repetitive elements. An excellent tribute to a different era that still feels good today. Well designed and polished, making an excellent use of the retro style. Sprinkled with evil.

17564967.review:
80年代の名作アクションゲーム「魂斗羅」（というか欧州版の「プロボテクター」）を完全にリスペクトしたアクションシューティングゲーム。

プレイヤーはサイボーグ戦士（V1とV2の2種類いるが、肩飾りの有無以外の違いは無し。）を動かし、5種類の武器（フルオート連射だが、専用ボタンによる溜め撃ちあり）を駆使して次々と襲い掛かってくるエイリアンを倒しながら先に進んでいくという、当時のアクションゲームとしてはよくある内容。

このゲームの最大の特徴はなんといっても作者は相当好きだったのか元ネタである魂斗羅のリスペクト感が半端でないこと。

操作性を含めたプレイ感や音楽の雰囲気はもちろんのこと、敵の行動パターンをしっかりと覚えていれば何とかクリアできる絶妙な難易度調整はまさしく魂斗羅そのもので個人的に懐かしい気持ちで楽しませてもらった。

また、このゲーム独自の機能としてゲームを途中で中断してもそのステージの最初から再開できるセーブ機能やエフェクトを少し豪華にする機能（といっても半透明機能の使用のON,OFFと、回転表現を滑らかにするかだけだが、、）という今風（？）の機能もあり、ゲーム自体の出来は個人的に問題ない。

ただ、いくつかゲーム性以外の問題がいくつかあり、ソレを述べると、、

・他方でのおっしゃっている通り、Xinputパッド（当方ロジテックの「F310」使用。）の左スティックの操作に限り斜め入力利かない事。
（一応Dパッド（十字キー）やF310のMODEボタンを有効にしたときの左スティック操作は問題なく斜め入力が利く。ちなみにこの問題はDesraで先行販売されていた「2014/07/16」Verでは発生せず。）

具体的には半透明表示とスプライトのスムーズ回転

言うまでもないがファミコンだって半透明表示は可能だ
しかし食らい無敵以外では滅多なことでは使われない

このゲームでは半透明をオンにすると無敵状態に加えて

17014894.review:
Were you a fan of Contra when it hit arcades?  Were you a fan of Contra when it was ported to consoles?  Have you been a fan of contra since the begining, or were even newly introduced to the game, lured by challenge and generally fun gameplay?  Well, I cannot recommend this game more for you.  It captures the spirit of contra, it and provides quite the enjoyable experience.

I would give this game a 10 out of 10, but there is one part of the game that is really holding it back from greatness.  I don't care what your opinions or intentions were in designing stage 6 of this game, but there is and will not be an excusable reason to include THE WORST ASPECTS OF SUPER CONTRA AND CONTRA 3!  As a matter of fact, every game in the contra series to embrace the "top down shooter" model as been a dismall failure because it simply is not fun, no matter how easy it may be.  This game, did not make the top down stage fun either.  I would go so far as to recommed scrapping the stage all together.  Just make the cut, and render the game 6 stages long.  Or go the extra mile, and give us another side scrolling platformer stage.

The stage didn't work in any of the games the devs clearly pulled inspiration from, and nostalgia for the sake of nostalgia is never a winning business model, especially when it is painful nostalgia (IE, I will not play super contra again because of these stages).  They are terrible, they break the paradigm of gameplay that is established in the stages leading up to them, and following them, and the pace of the game is dropped to an almost litteral crawl when you get to them.  They are so jarring.

That being the case, the music in the game is amazing.  The sprite work, is top notch, and the levels are fricken cool to play through (barring stage 6... it was just boring to play through).

Stage 6 wouldn't be so bad, were it not so damn long.  I mean, it is literally the length of 2 stages put together, and even comes complete with check points (which is not excusing or making the stage out to be better than it could be, make no mistake...)

All things considered, the game is awsome.  It is a solid release, that I have not been able to break in any of the time I have been playing.  The bosses were clever (albe it incredibly frustrating to figure out at times), and I am currently looking into the harder difficulties the game has to offer.  Normal mode, is actually pretty difficult by comparison to other games of this genre.

I am not sure the game required a save feature that saves your game at check points.  It does kinda... make the game much easier to be able to keep repeating from where you last saved.  Part of the charm of the games this game is inspired from, are that by the time you make it past stage 7, you have mastered stages 1-6.  This game just allows you to fumble past each stage and get lucky in some cases, powering through your lives in hopes that you can barely beat the boss of the stage and get to the check point.

All and all though, it is worth the investment, and comes complete with Netplay so you can play with friends from a distance so you won't get punched in the shoulder or face when you jump the screen to high, and burn their last life.

Pick this game up.  Its worth the money, if this genre of action platformer is your cup of tea.

17001668.review:
Super Cyborg is a very polished Contra-styled arcade run and gun shooter. It controls identical to Contra in terms of movement, shooting, and jump physics. Level design is also extremely reminiscient of Contra.

Super Cyborg plays really well, with lots of very varied level and boss designs. It's playstyle is much closer to the older Contra's, as it emphasizes platforming and constantly moving forward over the "boss rush" style gameplay of later titles (see: Hardcorps, Shattered Soldier, and many Treasure titles). I found this refreshing, since I like the constant push forward in older titles.

It is much harder then the older Contras however, and not in the way I would have liked. I'm an arcade game veteran who's 1 life cleared Ninja Gaiden, Ghouls and Ghosts, and various shmups, and I have to say that this game requires an absurd amount of memorization. Usually, I play these sorts of games on one credit, restarting from the beginning when I game over, but this sort of playstyle is not feasible for Super Cyborg until you've learned the whole game. You need a plan and a route for every stage after the first 3, so you'll definitely want to grind some of the stages for a while with unlimited continues if you want to clear this game.

I'm also a bit more partial to challenges based on reflexes and improvisation. I always enjoyed Contra 1-3 and Ghouls and Ghosts because many of the enemy behaviors were extremly randomized and required on the spot reflexes instead of just planning. Super Cyborg has a few spots like this, but it's much more static and memorization focused in general. If you like formulating plans and routes for strategic gameplay, you'll likely enjoy this, but it's not quite to my tastes.

Overall, I like SC quite a bit. It does a lot of great things, and its platforming focus is a breath of fresh air for run and gun shooters. It's not quite my ideal run and gun shooter, but it's definitely worth it for fans of the genre.

16952251.review:
This game is maximum badass to the maximum. As someone who has played way too much Super C on NES, this game has some guts. I found this game on Recently Released page when the game got released. At first it looked like any other random indie scrubbity scrub but as the trailer went on and showed the gameplay, it was pretty clear that I have to try this right away.

Super Cyborg has some heavy inspiration from Super C (or Probotector 2, since our heroes are robots) which is a good thing for my point of view due Super C did improve the game in so many ways compared to original NES Contra. Better jump physics, top down levels, mid-bosses and non-spread weapons are actually powerful. This is exactly what Super Cyborg has but with some extra spice on it.

You can for example lock your position so you can shoot any direction you want without moving. This is insanely handy when you want to fire diagonally without running back and fourth for example when fighting against stationary turrets. Super Cyborg also has an ability to charge your weapon (it has own button for it) which adds some damage to the shot. Pretty useful against bosses to get that accurate damage going.

Speaking of bosses, there are two types of bosses in this game. There are bosses that are trial and error and there are bosses that actually requires you to be awake and focus on the battle. While trial and error bosses aren't too nice, they are definitely much better than Super C bosses that were insanely boring and easily the weakest point of the game.

This game also supports online co-op which is very nice. Unfortunately I only have one friend that won't lose all his lives on the first level and he lives at the other side of the globe which this game does not like at all. I highly recommend getting a friend that is pretty close to you (read: region) to enjoy online co-op the fullest.

Super Cyborg is a great game, but it won't get a perfect score from me. There are some areas in the game that requires you to have a powerful weapon or you have going to have insanely bad time. Good example is the rolling corpse ball thing in final level. If you are unable to get the spread in there and you have playing with default gun instead, it gets insanely tricky since you can't hit the ball diagonally unless you are about to get hit by it. It could be me just being bad but any powerup before that section would be nice.

One of the features I would like to see in this game is the ability to go back to level 1 from the game over screen. In Super C the game goes back to title screen after 3 game overs but in order to start all over again in Super Cyborg, you have to go back to the menu and then make a new game which takes a bit more time than just pressing "Restart Game" or something. I find it a good way to try perfecting earlier levels and get prepared for later levels better.

I'm actually amazed how Super Cyborg hasn't gotten any showlight from Steam. People don't even know this game is being sold in Steam which is a real bummer. Super Cyborg is a hidden, rough looking gem and while apparently it has been out in Desura for some time, it was my personal GOTY for 2015.

So do I recommend this game to you? If you have played too much Contra/Super C, this is a must buy. Don't even think about it, go for it. For everybody else, you can download a demo and try it. It's a difficult game but success always will be rewarded.

16951184.review:
If you have a craving for some contra-esque gameplay this will certainly satisfy the craving.

This game looks, plays, and feels extremely similiarly to the original Contra released way back when on the NES. There's even the "flying football" power up holders, You can certainly feel that this game was made by people who loved Contra and wanted to recreate the joy they felt when they played. 

The weapons are all the classic Contra 1 weapons, you have your M powerup, for machinegun which is basically a much faster and more powerful version of your basic gun, S spreadshot which is pretty self explanatory, E for electric shot which is a reskin of the original fire burst shot (and IMO makes more sense) and L for laser (Protip: rapidly hit the shot button with this weapon for DEVASTATING results). There's also a R powerup which adds rapidfire to whatever you're currently using. They added a couple of interesting twists, the weapons all have alternate fire modes that are basically charged up power shots, and there are hidden power ups in the levels. (I have yet to find these "hidden powerups" but they're hinted at in the achievements.

There's both local and online coop which is a great feature, this kind of game is best enjoyed with a friend. Online coop is handled via user hosted lobbys, but I have yet to play with anyone so I can't honestly say how well that handles.

You can also change the color and sprite (albeit a minimal change) of your character which is also a rather nice feature. The detail on the boss sprites is incredible and you can really get a feel of the "grotesque alien mutation look" they were going for. My only complaint when it comes to the enemy design is that certain enemies look pretty lackluster, like the eyeball enemies in the first 2nd and 3rd stages in particular.

Gameplay wise, the controls feel solid and precise and can be adjusted to suit just about any taste. You can even adjust your x and y axis which is somewhat rare for a side scroller. The level designs flow well, and you have a pretty decent chance to see what's trying to kill you before it gets a chance. There are 3 levels of difficulty and there's a significant difference between the 3. I don't recommend you play on normal alone unless you have VERY good reflexes or you're a glutton for pinishment. Boss patterns change with difficulty so there's an incentive to replay in that regards. 

I recommend this game to fans of Contra or side scrollers in general. the price is right and it's quite fun.
